sentence.idiomatic: Recently the Industry and Commerce Department penalized quite a number of restaurants that didn't comply with sanitation requirements.
I was punished by the company because of making a serious error at work.
In accordance with the school's regulations, students who cheat on the exam will be punished.
The deterioration of the city's air pollution has brought a lot of serious problems.
The government imposed tax on farmers and it has increased their burdens.
Because of not taking his medicine on time his condition deteriorated quickly.
He is very mischievous. Usually he can only complete his homework when it's under his parents' supervision.
The mayor personally supervised the relevant department's investigation of that case.
It is extremely necessary for the government to strengthen supervision of food safety.
Before purchasing a house, people should understand clearly the content of the contract in order to keep the developer from exploiting any loopholes.
Several years ago, the laws weren't very strong. He earned a lot of money cheating consumers by exploiting legal loopholes.
This company exploits the loopholes in the imperfect parts of the contract, causing its partner great dissatisfaction.
The construction of the subway finally improved the terrible traffic conditions in this city.
The shutdown of that chemical enterprise greatly improved the air quality.
Recently his attitude towards me hasn't improved at all, he is still very cold.
This is a new branch of learning so many facets of its theory have not been perfect yet.
In the past, China's economic system wasn't strong enough. Now the government is trying hard to strengthen the economic system.
Our company wants to be become a first-class multinational group. What systems should be further strengthened?
He published my photo without getting my consent. He infringed on my right of portraiture.
This company was sued in the courts because it infringed on another's patent.
This interview is being conducted under the principle of not violating the privacy of others.
The court ruled that ownership of this house be returned to the older brother.
On the basis of the latest issued law, he was given a judgment of imprisonment for a term of one year.
The court has pronounced judgment in favor of the plaintiff, and the child is awarded to the plaintiff.
They are twins, so they look exactly alike.
If you look carefully, you will find that these two signatures aren't exactly alike.
Why is your thesis exactly the same as this one? Who copied whose anyways?
The country should use stronger laws to regulate the market economy.
Parents should regulate their own behavior first prior to teaching their children.
Because the company didn't standardize it's commercial activity according to the laws, it received legal punishment.

A couple of days ago I went to a coffee shop. At first I thought it was a Starbucks. Who knew that it was just posing as a Starbucks! Its logo was almost identical to the real Starbucks logo. Don’t you think that’s obvious infringement?

Huh? I thought that this type of thing wasn’t happening anymore. This year, Starbucks America sued a Shanghai coffee shop that was using the same name. The outcome was that the court ruled that the Shanghai Starbucks infringed on the rights of Starbucks, and had to pay compensation in the amount of 500,000 yuan. Furthermore, they were to immediately stop using the same name. Wow, I had no idea there were still these kinds of imitations on the market.

Uh-huh. It seems like intellectual property rights are really a big problem that China is facing. Before, the laws were not as strong, so a lot of businesses couldn’t get protection. Now, the laws have improved, but there are still a lot of people looking for loopholes. This is detrimental to long-term economic development.

Also, a lot of domestic and international firms frequently encounter problems with respect to intellectual property rights; whether it’s trademark, copyright or patent issues. This has not only affected foreign investment in China, but has also caused huge losses to domestic enterprises and the cultural market. Consequently, there even have been a lot of professions that were not able to survive.

Right, right. But I think that hereafter it should improve somewhat. Ever since China joined the WTO, the government has taken protection of intellectual property rights more and more seriously. I have heard that the government has specially set up a correlating department to carry out the supervision and oversight of these matters. Furthermore, they have also made the penalties for violation of infringement laws more serious.

Really? In my opinion supervision is important, but public awareness is equally as important. In our daily lives, we have all done something to infringe on intellectual property rights to some degree, for example: download music, buy pirated DVDs, buy fake brand name goods, etc. So, I think that if we genuinely want to solve this problem, everyone has to diligently regulate their own behavior.
